2012-11-30.lead_paragraph: Ranbaxy Pharmaceuticals, the largest producer of the generic version of Lipitor, has halted production of the drug until it can figure out how some pills were contaminated with glass particles.
2012-11-30.abstract: Ranbaxy Pharmaceuticals, largest producer of the generic version of Lipitor, halts production of the drug until it can figure out why glass particles may have ended up in pills that were distributed to the public; episode is only latest in history of manufacturing lapses at the company.

headline.seo: Ranbaxy, a Generic Drug Maker, Stops Making Cholesterol Pill
headline.main: Maker of Generic Lipitor Halts Production
headline.print_headline: Maker of Generic Lipitor Halts Production

2012-11-30.lead_paragraph: Manslaughter convictions against Continental Airlines were overturned in a case involving an Air France Concorde jet whose deadly crash hastened the end of commercial supersonic travel.
2012-11-30.abstract: French appeals court overturns involuntary manslaughter conviction against Continental Airlines for its role in the 2000 crash of an Air France Concorde jet that killed 113 people.

headline.main: French Court Overturns Convictions in Concorde Crash
headline.print_headline: Court Overturns Continental’s Conviction in Crash

2012-11-30.lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department raised its estimate for economic growth, and the Labor Department reported that first-time applications for unemployment benefits fell last week.
2012-11-30.abstract: Stocks rise after investors recover from pessimistic report on federal budget talks and take solace from reports on economic growth and unemployment claims.

headline.print_headline: Economic Reports Help Shares Gain Ground

2012-11-30.snippet: Major chains including Macy’s, Nordstrom, Kohl’s and Target said their sales declined in November, which included the important Black Friday kickoff of the holiday shopping season....
2012-11-30.lead_paragraph: Major chains including Macy’s, Nordstrom, Kohl’s and Target said their sales declined in November, which included the important Black Friday kickoff of the holiday shopping season.
2012-11-30.abstract: Thomson Reuters reports that sales at stores open at least a year jumped by only 1.6 percent in November, falling far short of 3.3 percent expected by analysts; period includes the key shopping days of Thanksgiving and Black Friday.

headline.main: Sales at Nation’s Retailers Fell Short of Expectations in November
headline.print_headline: Sales at Nation’s Retailers Fell Short of Expectations in November

byline.contributor: Christopher Maag contributed reporting from Columbus, Ohio.

2012-11-30.snippet: The Commerce Department increased its estimate of third-quarter economic growth from a 2 percent annual rate, but economists do not see that level continuing....
2012-11-30.lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department increased its estimate of third-quarter economic growth from a 2 percent annual rate, but economists do not see that level continuing.
2012-11-30.abstract: Commerce Department reports that gross domestic product expanded at an annual rate of 2.7 percent in the third quarter, exceeding earlier estimates; economists warn that pace of expansion could slow dramatically in the final months of the year due to the fiscal standoff and other factors; Labor Department reports weekly first-time unemployment claims dropped by 23,000, to 393,900 in previous week.

headline.seo: Upward Revision in G.D.P. Hides Weakness in Economy
headline.main: U.S. Growth Revised Up, but Year-End Slowdown Is Feared
headline.print_headline: Analysts Say Rosier View Of Growth Is Deceiving

2012-11-30.lead_paragraph: In a twice-yearly report on the financial system, Mervyn A. King said British banks could be underestimating the risks facing them and should be urged to raise their reserves.
2012-11-30.abstract: Bank of England report finds that British banks need more capital to protect them against fallout from the crisis in the euro zone, the Libor rate-manipulation litigation and other potential costs.

headline.main: British Banks May Be Undercapitalized, Bank of England Governor Warns
headline.print_headline: British Banks Are Urged to Bolster Capital
